summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between FBI and USMS personnel regarding a potential International Megan's Law (IML) violation by Jeffrey Epstein. It details unreported international travel by Epstein to Vienna, Austria and Morocco in March and April 2019, and expresses concern that he is a flight risk.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of investigation, registered sex offender
persons.context: The central subject of the email chain. He is identified as an FBI target nationwide and is under investigation for failing to report international travel as required by the International Megan's Law (IML) sex offender registry.

persons.name: Senior Inspector
persons.context: A USMS Senior Inspector from the Sex Offender Investigations Branch, Florida/Caribbean Region, who is investigating Epstein for IML violations and provided the travel documentation.

connections.description: The Senior Inspector is investigating Epstein for potential violations of the International Megan's Law (IML) related to unreported travel.

events.title: Epstein signs IML travel notification form
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed the Virgin Islands sex offender registry Notification of Duty to Report Travel (IML) form.

events.title: Unreported travel to Vienna
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria with three female passengers, where they went for coffee. This travel appears not to have been reported as required by IML.

events.title: Unreported travel to Morocco
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Morocco. This travel appears not to have been reported as required by IML.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was under active FBI investigation nationwide as of July 2019 and was considered a flight risk.
Epstein was a registered sex offender in the Virgin Islands and was legally required to report international travel under International Megan's Law (IML).
Epstein signed the IML travel notification form on March 15, 2019, but then failed to report trips to Vienna, Austria (March 22, 2019) and Morocco (April 25, 2019).
The USMS investigator expressed concern that public disclosure of this IML investigation could hamper their ability to confirm information, given Epstein's resources.
The information was being shared between the FBI San Juan Division (St. Thomas & St. Croix), the FBI in NYC, and the USAO in SDNY to support the position that Epstein was a flight risk.
